citation.article-title: Deoxyribonucleic acid homology studies of Lactobacillus casei, Lactobacillus paracasei sp. nov., subsp. paracasei and subsp. tolerans, and Lactobacillus rhamnosus sp. nov., comb. nov.

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus rhamnosus sp. nov.
Lactobacillus rhamnosus (pa.ra.ca'se.i. Gr.prep. para, resembling; L.gen.n. casei, a specific epithet; M.L.adj. paracasei, resembling L . casei)
Cells are rod shaped (ca. 0.8 to 1.0 by 2.0 to 4.0 μm), often with square ends, and occur singly or in chains.
Grows at 15 and 45°C; most strains grow at 10°C, and some strains grow at 48°C.

Acid is produced from amygdalin, arbutin, cellobiose, D-fructose, galactose, β-gentiobiose, gluconate, D-glucose, lactose, mannitol, D-mannose, maltose, melezitose, N-acetylglucosamine, rhamnose, ribose, salicin, sorbitol, D-tagatose, and trehalose.
Most strains produce acid from glycerol, inositol, D-lyxose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, L-sorbose, sucrose, and D-turanose.

Acid is not produced from adonitol, L-arabinose, D-arabitol, L-arabitol, erythritol, D-fucose, inulin, 2-keto-gluconate, 5-keto-gluconate, α-methyl-mannoside, β-methyl-xyloside, starch, xylitol, D-xylose, and L-xylose.
Ammonia is not produced from arginine.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA ranges from 45 to 47 mol%.
Isolated from dairy products, sewage, humans, and clinical sources.
The type strain is strain ATCC 7469 (= NCDO 243).
In most respects the description of the type strain resembles the description of the species.
The type strain produces acid from inositol, D-lyxose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, L-sorbose, and D-turanose; acid is not produced from D-arabinose, dulcitol, and glycerol.
